definition[0]: to continue to do something, although this is difficult, or other people oppose it
example[0]: ‘I don’t think it’s right, ’ John persisted.
example[1]: He persisted in his refusal to admit responsibility.
example[2]: She persisted with her studies in spite of financial problems.
example[3]: She persisted in asking the question
bad_example[0]: She persisted to ask the question
definition[1]: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen
example[4]: If the pain persists, you must see a doctor.
